In reality, what we need to do here is not set it in build_pytorch_libs.bat and CMakeLists.txt will default USE_CUDNN=ON based on the value of USE_CUDA. This is how build_pytorch_libs.sh does it on *nix and macOS. Thanks for the catch @fmder!

Unfortunately we'll need to wait until Windows tests pass on master before we land this again. Also, I'll verify USE_CUDNN=ON in the summary output when we get a successful run.

body:
In reality, what we need to do here is *not* set it in `build_pytorch_libs.bat` and `CMakeLists.txt` will default `USE_CUDNN=ON` based on the value of `USE_CUDA`. This is how `build_pytorch_libs.sh` does it on *nix and macOS. Thanks for the catch @fmder!

Unfortunately we'll need to wait until Windows tests pass on master before we land this again. Also, I'll verify USE_CUDNN=ON in the summary output when we get a successful run.
